intro: Jacquinia paludicola, commonly known as the swamp gentian, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in environments with high humidity. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are often hairy. Jacquinia paludicola plays an important ecological role in supporting pollinators and maintaining wetland biodiversity.
